articles.title: Lucid trims 12% of workforce as it seeks profitability: Report
articles.summary: Lucid is ​laying off 12% ‌of its ⁠workforce ⁠to "improve ​operational effectiveness ​and optimize our ​resources ⁠as ‌we ​continue ​on ⁠our path toward ​profitability," TechCrunch reported ​on Friday, ‌citing an ​internal ​memo.

articles.title: PM Modi's 'Zero Defect, Zero Effect' vision is the core of India's manufacturing push: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India's manufacturing and exports must prioritize quality, Union Minister Piyush Goyal stated. This focus aligns with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision for a 'zero defect, zero effect' economy. India aims for a USD 30-35 trillion economy by 2047, built on quality, sustainability, and inclusivity. This initiative seeks to elevate Brand India's global reputation for reliability and trust.

articles.title: Nexus Select, Runwal Enterprises form JV to develop 7.3 lakh sq ft retail mall
articles.summary: Nexus Select Trust, backed by Blackstone, is partnering with Runwal Enterprises for a new retail mall in Dombivli. This 7.30 lakh sq ft development represents Nexus's first venture into an under-construction retail project. The mall will be part of the Runwal Garden City township, offering a ready customer base.

articles.title: India poised to capture big share of $800 bln APAC data centre boom: Deloitte
articles.summary: India can become a major data centre hub in Asia. This requires solving power and grid issues. Renewable energy integration must match digital growth. India has cost advantages and a skilled workforce. Government policies offer incentives. Data centre capacity will grow significantly by 2030. This expansion will increase electricity demand. Addressing these challenges will position India for digital leadership.

articles.title: India, Brazil have huge potential to grow trade: Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva
articles.summary: Lula highlighted the rapid growth in economic ties between the two countries and the untapped potential. In 2006, bilateral trade was only about $200 million, which rose to $2.4 billion a few years later, and reached $15 billion last year. "I have with me possibly the biggest delegation of ministers, businesspeople of all the different trips that I have taken up until now, and this shows the commitment that I have with India," said Lula.

articles.title: Jharkhand's economy projected to grow by 5.96% in 2026-27 fiscal: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Jharkhand's economy is set for growth. Projections show a 5.96 percent expansion in the 2026-27 fiscal year. This follows an estimated 6.17 percent growth in the previous year. Per capita income is expected to surpass one lakh rupees. The state's Gross State Domestic Product is also on an upward trajectory. These figures highlight a positive economic outlook for Jharkhand.

articles.title: HAL correction a ‘wait and watch’; select midcap IT names emerging despite AI disruption: Mayuresh Joshi
articles.summary: Investors are advised patience with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) despite its strong order book, as recent sentiment shifts and current valuations warrant caution. In the IT sector, selective opportunities exist in midcap players like KPIT, Mphasis, and Datamatics, driven by AI adaptability. IDFC First Bank requires trust repair and regulatory clarity before fresh exposure.

articles.title: Price targets, ratings of big IT companies cut on 'downside risks'
articles.summary: Jefferies has downgraded several major Indian IT stocks, including Infosys and TCS, citing AI-related disruptions and greater downside risks. The brokerage shifted its preference to mid-sized IT firms, identifying Coforge, Sagility, and IKS as top picks with projected returns of 19-26%.

articles.title: Bharti Airtel to invest ₹20,000 cr for scaling up newly formed NBFC arm
articles.summary: Bharti Airtel is injecting ₹20,000 crore into its new NBFC, Airtel Money, to fuel its next growth phase. This move aims to expand financial services across India by leveraging Airtel's digital assets and data expertise. The company plans to offer digital lending and credit solutions, building on its existing successful credit engine.

articles.title: Indian AI innovations make their mark
articles.summary: At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, Indian deeptech startups showcased innovations beyond services, from electric air taxis to autonomous delivery robots. The most striking moment came from eight-year-old Ranvir Sachdeva, the youngest keynote speaker, linking ancient Indian philosophy with AI. These developments signal India’s move into frontier technology.

articles.title: Voice, vernacular, victory!
articles.summary: Technology companies and startups are betting big on voice AI models. Experts say Indian firms are more likely to crack it with affordable pricing and local context.

articles.title: Creator commerce startup Wishlink raises $17.5 million, led by Vertex Ventures
articles.summary: Creator commerce platform Wishlink has raised $17.5 million in a round led by Vertex Ventures Southeast Asia and India, with participation from existing investors Fundamentum and Elevation Capital.

articles.title: GDP ill-suited for the age of AI, Sam Altman tells Vinod Khosla
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman believes GDP is an inadequate measure of quality of life due to AI's deflationary impact. He predicts a vastly deflationary economy by 2035, necessitating a societal reimagining for a world of abundance driven by automated scientific discovery and economic progress.

articles.title: The missing blocks of India's AI puzzle
articles.summary: Everyone at last week’s India AI Impact Summit was debating power, water, and capital. Those are necessary conversations. But India’s AI infrastructure story has two other protagonists that nobody is talking about and without them, the puzzle never gets finished.

articles.title: Balancing AI and copyright; Adani's $100B bet
articles.summary: Day 2 of the India AI Impact Summit featured additional announcements, sessions, and policy discussions focused on emerging technology. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Passenger vehicle sales keep the momentum in Jan, rise in double digits for a 4th month
articles.summary: Indian auto sales are off to a strong start in the new year. Passenger vehicle sales saw double-digit growth for the fourth month running in January. Two- and three-wheeler segments also posted significant gains. This positive trend indicates sustained demand and supports economic activity across the country. The automotive sector is poised for continued growth.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: Goyal urges industry to raise quality standards to achieve $2 trillion export target
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal called on industry to meet global quality norms, use export support schemes, and cut non-tariff barriers to help India reach its $2 trillion export goal.

articles.title: FY27 may see earnings recovery, but valuations remain a concern: UTI's Vetri Subramaniam
articles.summary: UTI AMC CEO Vetri Subramaniam expects structural growth opportunities to continue as more Indian investors increase participation in financial markets and long-term financial planning.

articles.title: India must invest in children, skills and manufacturing to harness demographic dividend: BVR Subrahmanyam
articles.summary: BVR Subrahmanyam at AIMA stresses India's growth, urging investment in skills, manufacturing, agriculture, FDI, and climate tech for sustained progress.

articles.title: AI won’t kill India’s services economy, it will upgrade it: Vijay Shekhar Sharma
articles.summary: Vijay Shekhar Sharma believes AI will expand India’s services economy, transforming BPOs into global healthcare providers and reshaping finance with AI-powered advisory and underwriting.

articles.title: Tomato, onion and potato price shocks drive bulk of inflation volatility: RBI study
articles.summary: Vegetable price spikes, especially in tomato, onion and potato, account for over 80% of recent headline inflation volatility, according to a Reserve Bank of India study.

articles.title: India revises base year of merchandise trade indices to FY23 to reflect changing trade patterns

articles.title: Strong manufacturing growth lifts India's private sector in February, PMI shows

articles.title: India’s FTAs now unlock 70% of global GDP, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal highlights India’s nine FTAs, including with the United States, boosting export access to 70 percent of global GDP. Bharat Mart in Dubai and AI Summit investments drive growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth slips to 4% in January; momentum eases from December high
articles.summary: India’s core sector growth slowed to 4% in January 2026, with steel and cement expanding strongly while coal, crude oil, and natural gas production weakened, signaling broad-based moderation.

However, market participants say the shift is driven by relative valuations and earnings cycles rather than a weakening of India’s fundamentals, leaving the door open for a return of foreign flows if growth momentum improves.

articles.summary: Mukul Roy, veteran West Bengal politician and former railway minister, passed away in Kolkata at 73. A founding TMC member, he was key to Mamata Banerjee's rise but later joined BJP.

articles.title: When is Holi 2026, March 3 or 4? Know about Holika Dahan muhurta and festival's significance
articles.summary: Holi does not follow the Gregorian calendar. It is determined by the Hindu lunar calendar and falls on the full moon (Purnima) in the month of Phalguna. Holika Dahan will be observed on March 3, with Rangawali Holi on March 4.

articles.title: Tirumala to use 'E-Tongue' and 'E-Nose' in ₹25 crore lab to test prasadam quality

articles.summary: Delhi Police has busted a Bangladesh terror module run by Shabir Ahmed Lone, who was in direct contact with LeT commander Hafeez Saeed. Lone, a Kashmiri resident, was released on bail in 2019 and fled to Bangladesh. He was tasked with recruiting and radicalizing illegal Bangladeshi migrants in India, arranging fake IDs and weapons for potential attacks.

articles.summary: A Delhi-bound air ambulance carrying seven people, including a patient, doctor, and two crew members, crashed in Jharkhand shortly after taking off from Ranchi. The Beechcraft C90 aircraft lost contact with air traffic control after requesting a weather deviation. A search and rescue operation is underway, with an investigation team dispatched.

articles.title: ET Explainer: What will US tariff be now?
articles.summary: Following an agreement on a framework for an interim trade deal earlier this month, the US announced it will cut the reciprocal tariff on India to 18% and remove the additional 25% punitive tariffs. Currently, India's goods exports to the US are subject to 25% reciprocal tariff. The February 6 joint statement on the framework for an interim deal proposed lowering this rate to 18% but the change has yet to be implemented.

articles.title: Trump eyes Section 301 probes as tariff backup: What it means for global trade and why it matters
articles.summary: America's trade chief signals new investigations under Section 301. This law allows action against unfair foreign trade practices. Probes could cover industrial policies, drug pricing, digital trade, and ocean pollution. Such moves could lead to new tariffs or trade restrictions. This signals a potential return to aggressive trade enforcement by the US.
